header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/as_args.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a facility used to map an to individual arguments in invocations of user-defined macros by library algorithms.

macro.abstract: The macro is used to map an to individual arguments in invocations of user-defined macros by library algorithms.

usage.param: The arity of the library algorithm target macro. Valid values range from 2 to .

macro.para:
This macro may be used with every library algorithm that allows a user-defined macro to expand to a and contains a state or auxiliary data argument. These algorithms also allow a double user-specified operation as a macro name (i.e. a non-) of the following form:
B A
The A macro is invoked as normal but expands to the argument list for the invocation of B. An invocation of the macro plays the role of A against some user-specified macro B.

The function of this macro is to produce a macro of arity n that transforms the argument list that it is passed by incrementing its first argument (s) and converting its last argument (a state or auxiliary data argument) from an to a comma-separated list of arguments:
(s, (2, (x, y))) // ((s), x, y) (s, p, (3, (a, b, c))) // ((s), p, a, b, c)
This minimizes the amount of data structure access that is necessary when variadic arguments cannot be used.
